summary: This is a sealed federal indictment from the Southern District of New York charging Ghislaine Maxwell with six counts related to the sexual exploitation of minors, including conspiracy to entice minors to travel for illegal sex acts, transportation of a minor, and perjury. The indictment details Maxwell's role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the abuse of multiple minor girls by Jeffrey Epstein between approximately 1994 and 1997, and alleges she lied under oath in 2016 to conceal her conduct.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Charged with conspiracy, enticement, transportation of minors, and perjury for her role in facilitating Jeffrey Epstein's sexual abuse of minor girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary abuser of minor girls, with Maxwell assisting in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating access to victims.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signed the indictment as the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Described as having a personal and professional relationship; intimate partners who conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse minor girls together.
Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his various properties during the time period of the alleged conspiracy.
Maxwell met, groomed, and participated in the sexual abuse of Minor Victim-1, starting when the victim was approximately 14.
Maxwell interacted with and groomed Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico, including providing an unsolicited topless massage.
Maxwell groomed and befriended Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged massages knowing they would lead to sexual abuse.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-1 in New York and Florida, with Maxwell's facilitation.
Epstein invited Minor Victim-2 to New Mexico for the purpose of grooming and sexual abuse.
Epstein sexually abused Minor Victim-3 on multiple occasions, including during massages arranged by Maxwell.

events.title: Conspiracy to Abuse Minors
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls, with victims as young as 14.

events.title: Minor Victim-1 Travel from Florida to New York
events.description: Minor Victim-1 was enticed to travel from Florida to New York for the purpose of being sexually abused by Epstein at his New York residence.

events.title: Interaction with Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell and Epstein interacted with Minor Victim-2 at Epstein's New Mexico ranch, where Maxwell provided an unsolicited topless massage as part of grooming.

events.title: Grooming of Minor Victim-3 in London
events.description: Maxwell groomed Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and arranged interactions knowing they would lead to sexual abuse.

events.title: Maxwell's First Deposition Perjury
events.description: During a deposition, Maxwell falsely testified she was unaware of any scheme by Epstein to recruit underage girls for sexual massages and denied interacting with anyone under 18 other than the plaintiff.

events.title: Maxwell's Second Deposition Perjury
events.description: During a deposition, Maxwell gave false testimony regarding her awareness of sex toys at Epstein's home, Epstein's sexual activities with others, and whether she had ever given massages to Epstein or Minor Victim-2.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Ranch)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for legal proceedings)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with six federal counts: conspiracy to entice minors, enticement of a minor, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation of a minor, and two counts of perjury.
The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein conspired from at least 1994 to 1997 to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls, some as young as 14.
Maxwell is accused of facilitating abuse at multiple Epstein properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and at her own London residence.
The document specifies three minor victims (identified as Minor Victim-1, -2, -3) and details specific grooming and abuse acts involving each.
Maxwell is charged with perjury for false statements made under oath in 2016 depositions, where she denied knowledge of Epstein's scheme, interaction with other minors, and giving massages.
